data.title: Sinclair C6 Project Brief
data.meta_description: lecture note sinclair c6 project brief sir clive marles sinclair was an english entrepreneur and inventor, best known for being pioneer in the computing
data.text:
Sir Clive Marles Sinclair was an English entrepreneur and inventor, best known for being a pioneer in the computing industry, and as the founder of several companies that developed consumer electronics in the 1970s and early 1980s.

Project Summary

The Sinclair C5 was the brainchild of Sir Clive Sinclair. Sinclair was a visionary entrepreneur of his time, and, with his recent death, the estate has been tasked with solving the problems of the original C5 and launching a prototype that will serve the needs of a modern-day commuter. This project is set forth to re-design the C using modern technology and launch a prototype to be called the Sinclair C6.

Sir Clive Sinclair – Vision for the Sinclair C

Refer to the original marketing brochure located here: wearethemutants/2017/08/07/sinclair-c5- sales-brochure-1985/

Quite simply, the moto-car is not ideal to provide the intimate, personal transport we need as individuals. Which is where the Sinclair C5 comes in. Sinclair’s reputation is built on cutting giants down to size, turning impersonal tyrants into personal servants. Sinclair took a desk-top calculator and put it in your pocket& took the big-business computer and tucked it into your living room& took the television set and made it smaller than a paperback. Now, with the C5 Sinclair Vehicles puts personal, private transport back where it belongs – in the hand of the individual. Electric vehicles are the vehicles of the future. The Sinclair C5 represents the state of the art now – and for some time to come. But the C5 is just the beginning& by the early 1990s, Sinclair will have on the roads a range of fast, quiet, astonishingly economical family vehicles. And you can drive the first of the many – today!

Issues with the original Sinclair C5:

The original C5 faced serious problems with public perception from a botched marketing launch and negative reviews from the press.

Common concerns:

Too vulnerable in traffic because of its low profile,

A sharp turn easily lifts a rear wheel,

It is hazardously silent,

Disappears below a car driver's sight-line when pulling up alongside

Slow speeds would cause traffic jams,

Miniscule front and rear lights,

Exposure to the elements.

Location of the handlebars received a mixed review, some felt it was easy to master with the semi-recumbent driving position, some felt it was awkward and difficult to maneuver.

Project goals:

Honor the vision of the original C5,

Modernize the vehicle for today’s commuter,

Create a prototype Sinclair C6.

Preliminary requirements:

Vehicle must be safe,

Durable for multiple users,

Battery life and power must be maximized,

Vehicle dimensions should not exceed 200 cm in length by 120 cm wide,

Vehicle should be powerful enough to maintain speed on an 8% road grade while carrying 180 pounds,

Tolerant to various weather conditions,

Modern or futuristic design,

Electric powered,

Target speed should be around 40 MPH,

Mobile app with the following features: o GPS vehicle locator, o Connection to payment processing services including Bitcoin, o Rental start and stop services, o Maintenance notifications, o User manual and vehicle guides, o Mileage indicator, o Social opportunity to connect with other Sinclair C6 enthusiasts, o Reminders, o Others?

Requirements for consideration:

The C6 should be accessible for individuals with mobility issues,

There should be one model with all options,

Driverless feature,

Dashcam or other video devices.

Additional information:

The enhanced vision for the Sinclair C6 is a low-cost, small, commuter vehicle designed to be a shared service like urban scooter and bicycle rentals. A user should be able to use the mobile app to locate the nearest C6 and rent the vehicle for a period of time.

It is assumed, based on preliminary market research, that the Sinclair C6 may appeal to bicycle enthusiasts and an eclectic population of innovative and creative individuals in a dense urban setting. Portland Oregon has a large bicyclist population, has been rated one of the world’s best cities for cycling, and has a dense urban commuter population. Additionally, Portland has a culture of entrepreneurship, individual expression, and creativity. As such, Portland has been selected as the target market to launch the C6, and the design and feature set should align with the Portland demographic.
